content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: It is a simple exercise but it's a good challenge for those who are trying to do it as fast as possible
It's simple but a great exercise!

This is nice, and solvable in Reverse in under 5 minutes, but I really think you need another test/validator pair.

Currently, the test cases are n = 2, 1, -1, 0, 10. Which means that only 2 of the test cases don't give "Error" as the result. I think you really need at least one more test case that doesn't give "Error" so that clashers will have at least 3 examples to look at to be sure what the puzzle is about.

I suggest a test/validator pair with n = 6 and n = 7, maybe even another with n = 9 and n = 8. "n = 9" in particular would help clarify to clashers that the condition for "Error" is when n is not between 1 and 9.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Simple but fun
this is in a really nice sweet spot of complexity! i don't understand the reasoning for making zero an error, though; outputting just "0" seems more intuitive to me.

Stub generator
* Please add a write statement, e.g. "write answer".

Thanks.
The code provided is excellent! Thank you for the assistance.
